column1: Conservative leadership took the American economy to new heights before COVID-19. It's more important than ever that we elect conservative leaders to work with President Trump. I am asking for your vote to continue to represent you. https://t.co/Q1ROjPwmqd

Conservative leadership took the American economy to new heights before COVID-19. It's more important than ever that we elect conservative leaders to work with President Trump. I am asking for your vote to continue to represent you.

Under Trump and GOP leadership taxes are down and before COVID-19 jobs were up. If Biden is elected president he said he will repeal the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act raising the taxes of hard working Americans. It is critical that we reelect @realDonaldTrump

It is critical that we elect conservative leaders to rebuild America after COVID-19. I am asking for your vote so we can rebuild our record breaking economy. The last day to register to vote is October 13th.
Before Covid-19 the American economy was booming like never before. The leadership of the GOP and @realDonaldTrump unleashed the American economy. #Debates2020 https://t.co/GOq58B118q

While American families have been struggling during Covid-19 the Democrats have refused time and time again to give relief. A Biden presidency would be more liberal wish lists and no real solutions. #Debates2020
Criminals are using the COVID-19 pandemic to scam people. I am working to help protect senior citizens from these COVID-19 relief scams. https://t.co/FdgmCFEyKS

The coronavirus has greatly impacted our seafood industry which is a crucial part of our state. I am fighting to get relief for our fisheries to help get them through this tough time. https://t.co/izGI5OZEXt

The Suppress COVID-19 Act allows states to acquire tests at a lower price. This will help get the tests necessary to put in place strategies to reopen schools places of worship and workplaces safely.  https://t.co/uPCqk2KFS1

I want six more years to continue to fight for Louisiana families. From mental health reform to COVID-19 relief I fight everyday to solve the real issues facing Louisiana families. https://t.co/1ptNlTdvhO

The coronavirus pandemic has taken a toll on local governments. I am working to get them the resources necessary to continue to provide essential services for their communities. https://t.co/rNFiRR89Q4
Criminals are using the COVID-19 pandemic to scam people. I am working to help protect senior citizens from these COVID-19 relief scams. https://t.co/NwT4XwpssM

Congratulations to Louisiana native Mark Menezes for being confirmed as the new Deputy Secretary of Energy. Mark will do a great job as we work to strengthen our energy industry hard hit by COVID-19 create jobs here in Louisiana and once again unleash American energy dominance.

Louisiana fishermen have been hit hard by the COVID-19 crisis and the downturn in the restaurant industry. I am fighting for more funding for our fisheries in the next relief package. They are a crucial part of our state and in need of aid. https://t.co/v81TUAqBi8

Louisiana is known for our culinary culture but because of the coronavirus restaurants that are part of the fabric of our communities are struggling. We need to support and provide the relief necessary to help these important local employers.  https://t.co/wLzn0jBRZz

Health care professionals shoulder the responsibility of saving lives. The COVID-19 pandemic adds to that stress & increases their own risk of becoming infected. We must give health care workers the support they need to continue their work of saving lives. https://t.co/OdZ4qILtdI

Our front line workers rely on PPE to protect them from the coronavirus while they work to save lives. I am fighting everyday to ensure our front line workers have the resources they need to combat the coronavirus and save lives. https://t.co/sTl7Fb11QJ

Louisiana has been one of the hardest hit states by the coronavirus. I am fighting everyday to help families and front line workers combat this virus through federal funding and resources for PPE. https://t.co/JR0jKG8CAQ

The past 6 years I’ve worked hard to listen to Louisianians and turn their ideas into policies that help Louisiana families. From mental health reform to coronavirus relief I am fighting to solve the issues facing Louisiana families. https://t.co/QRC7cMjXNq

Democrats released their socialist wish list (disguised as COVID19 relief) over two months ago so we would forget that it included items like: -Permanent federal take over of elections -Checks for illegal immigrants. -Tax payer funded abortions -Marijuana banking

As Congress debates a new coronavirus response bill the health and safety of the people of Louisiana remains my top priority. The Federal funding secured for LA to help combat COVID19 has saved countless lives and protected front line workers. https://t.co/cPEdRZaeBM

Yesterday I qualified for re-election to continue my work to solve real issues facing Louisiana families. Right now I am working with health care providers to ensure we have a smarter plan to get our state past the Coronavirus and provide targeted relief to struggling families. https://t.co/EzR0bFLTIx
We all have a part to play in stopping the spread of the coronavirus. Simple measures like wearing a mask and socially distancing can help save lives. https://t.co/D5RwSa3P8x

Criminals are taking advantage of the pandemic to flood the markets with counterfeit products that are inferior. Happy that the private-sector has stepped in to stop this but Congress must act to stop these criminals from hurting our COVID-19 fight. https://t.co/nJY3odyHHe

Our doctors and nurses are working tirelessly on the front lines to combat the coronavirus. Glad that our hospitals will be receiving necessary resources to aid our doctors and nurses in saving lives.  https://t.co/H8NIYSyq3A

The COVID-19 pandemic has evolved into more than just a public health crisis. In order to solve the economic and education issues we must all do our part to stop the spread of the coronavirus https://t.co/il37JvVMaQ

Great to announce that rural and safety net hospitals will be receiving resources to help them combat COVID-19. This funding is necessary so they can continue to treat coronavirus patients in vulnerable communities. https://t.co/RT0T8AiJCp

Telehealth has helped bring affordable access to care to rural communities during the Covid-19 pandemic. Increasing telehealth can reduce the cost of health care and improve health outcomes. https://t.co/jXRMnUNpbA

We all have a part to play to beat the #coronavirus so we can return to normal. Wearing masks helps protect our neighbors who are at a high risk of dying from this disease. We should do unto others as you would have them do unto you. https://t.co/uDT9jFRmvO
Happy to welcome @VP Pence to Louisiana today to discuss how we can better combat COVID-19. https://t.co/w4cIeeRVHE
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic the Tax filing deadline was moved to this Wednesday July 15th. https://t.co/rwXs46KiQj

Workers who were born in 1960 should not see their Social Security arbitrarily lowered because of COVID19. Americans should not have their financial security altered just because they turned 60 during the COVID19 pandemic.

Americans work hard with the promise of Social Security upon retirement but because of COVID19 those benefits are at risk. Workers deserve to receive all of their Social Security  despite the pandemic. That’s why I’m fighting to protect retirees benefits  https://t.co/xAFOW8iDWN

Businesses across the state are taking precautions to slow the spread of COVID19 but we have seen an increase in cases here in LA. That’s why it’s critical that we each play our part in slowing the spread by wearing masks and socially distancing https://t.co/WcQ79UzDOl
The Coronavirus should not harm the Social Security of workers that are retiring this year. Help me protect Social Security by signing up below:https://t.co/vUETHRx5HJ
Workers should not lose out on Social Security benefits because of COVID-19. I am fighting to prevent benefit cuts for those nearing retirement with the Protecting Benefits for Retirees Act.

We cannot wait for a vaccine to fully reopen our economy. We all have a part to play in stopping the spread of COVID-19 by wearing masks washing our hands and sneezing into our sleeves. We will get through this together. https://t.co/uwVCZjDrww

Children are at risk of missing crucial learning and development time because of the COVID-19 pandemic. We must put in place a safe way for schools to reopen this fall. The Reopen Schools Safely Act will help school districts reopen in the fall. https://t.co/DGqQisxgrI

Lowering the price of prescription drugs has been one of my top priorities. We have passed major legislation to do just that but there is still much more to do especially in the face of increased health care costs due to the coronavirus. https://t.co/4klFtUVIEW

Affordable access to care is a serious issue facing Louisiana families. Telehealth has been instrumental in connecting patients & health care professionals during COVID19. We need to examine what has worked to further expand affordable access to care through choice in health care

Competition has led to major technological advances to bring affordable access to health care through telehealth during the COVID19 Pandemic. We can use what we learned during this outbreak & the power of competition to improve our health care system going forward

Using telehealth to improve access to care for rural Louisianans was an essential part of COVID19 relief. I’m working on real solutions like this to improve quality and price of health care while ensuring every Louisianan can have affordable coverage. https://t.co/S6Bv87VovD

FEMA has awarded Louisiana $225 million to help with our state's COVID19 response. Louisiana was one of the hardest hit states & the resources are badly needed. Although things are beginning to reopen we have a ways to go until the US is fully recovered https://t.co/cGEJ5LbTHs

Glad to see lives are beginning to get back to normal. We still need to wear masks and socially distance in public to beat #COVID19 but Louisiana is reopening and we have flattened the curve. This is great news for the re-ignition of the US economy. https://t.co/YhFPPsR4SG

Our hospitals are still in need of critical resources to help them fight the coronavirus. These funds allow our state’s hospitals to respond to the pandemic and serve the needs of patients  https://t.co/r1l9D1kFbo

COVID-19 notification programs can only work if people are assured their information is protected. Privacy & strict enforcement are necessary to protect against misuse of private information. Your privacy is my priority that is why I am fighting to put these guidelines in place.

Children are the key to the future but the coronavirus has disproportionately affected their education. In order for them to become the leaders of tomorrow kids must be able to return to school in the fall so they can receive the best education possible https://t.co/sq8IxBFO61

Contact tracing is a useful tool to combat COVID-19 but the government cannot force people to participate. Those that participate should not have to worry about their personal information being misused. That's why I'm fighting to ensure the rights of individuals are protected

Any COVID-19 contact tracing program must be voluntary and have strict guidelines so individuals can maintain their privacy. Enforcement rules must be in place to protect individuals from their data being misused. https://t.co/vh2FMU76or

Louisiana will begin phase 2 of reopening on Friday June 5th. This is a necessary and welcome step as local businesses recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. For a full list of what phase 2 means click here:  https://t.co/7Dmc1khykY

Central Private School broke ground last week after it had been flooded during the 2016 floods. Proud of our community's resilience. It is critical for our children that we have a working COVID-19 plan to ensure schools can open by next fall. https://t.co/2TvPukmz3c

Coronavirus has stretched our emergency response thin. With hurricane season approaching my Local Community Emergency Relief Act will ensure our communities are able to respond and recover from potential storm disasters this year. https://t.co/mjP7lSt8Q1
Education is the cornerstone of a child's future. We must reopen schools in the fall with a smart COVID-19 testing plan in place to protect the students and their families.

Today is the Oil and Natural Gas Virtual Industry day. The energy sector is the key economic driver in our state and it has been hit hard during the COVID-19 crisis. We need to support our Louisiana oil and gas workers.  https://t.co/xO1vbWPuo7
There is free coronavirus testing in Shreveport May 27-29th. Click here for more info https://t.co/zdwHK3aBmk

United Way of NWLA and the Salvation Army have teamed up and created a fund to help families in NWLA that were impacted by COVID-19. They are giving out grants to families in need during this tough time. For more info: https://t.co/sG6yfgvKCW
No new COVID-19 deaths in EBR for the first time in 2 months! This is great news as we continue to combat the coronavirus. https://t.co/m2E2lmblkU

Learning in the classroom is an essential part of a student's education. We must have classrooms open in the fall and to do that we must use COVID-19 testing smartly to protect our teachers and children. https://t.co/zVklJoVvp9

In order for our communities to safely open up we need to support our law enforcement and other essential service members. The SMART fund is common sense legislation to provide critical resources to cities and towns impacted the hardest by COVID-19.  https://t.co/2t0YZf6deb
Free Covid-19 testing began in Northeast LA on Monday. Although we are beginning to open up our communities it is imperative that if you show symptoms you get tested. https://t.co/N1HRYh8Wuu

House Democrats and @SpeakerPelosi are holding critical relief for COVID-19 hostage by surrounding it with countless liberal wish list items in their $3000000000000 COVID-19 bill. Pelosi's attempt at "relief" is completely disingenuous and politically motivated. https://t.co/lu7L9PZuPJ

The cities and towns hit hardest by COVID-19 are struggling to pay our police officers who keep our communities safe. The SMART Fund would ensure resources to support our law enforcement officers and preserve the Thin Blue Line. https://t.co/AJzRZEPDi1

The Revenue Estimating Committee has reported that COVID-19 will cause worse losses of state revenue than after Katrina. In order for our cities and towns to recover and continue to support Police and other essential services the SMART Fund must be passed https://t.co/3yuzyE5Hm0
The seafood industry has been hit hard during this COVID-19 crisis. Pleased to be able to work to get them relief during these tough times. https://t.co/xQmE62JJRs

Even though we are dealing with the COVID-19 crisis hurricane season is right around the corner. #HurricanePreparednessWeek is this week. Make sure to check your evacuation plans. https://t.co/Qj0ezREeU4

The seafood industry is a crucial part of the framework of our state but it has been hit hard by COVID19. Some have seen a decline of sales up to 95% which is why I'm working on getting relief to our seafood industry to help them through these tough times https://t.co/uGZTJTqy7z

Today Laura and I will be taking part in the #NationalDayofPrayer to pray for those who have been impacted by COVID-19. We must all come together as one community of faith to pray for those suffering in our communities.
I discussed the upcoming Senate session and updates during the COVID-19 crisis in my most recent interview with @talk1073 . Check it out here: https://t.co/LcCjzrUz0E

By taking a scientific approach we can quicken the reopening of our communities. We must target hotspot areas to contain the spread of COVID-19 through contact tracing and testing. By focusing our resources on these areas we can better move to safely reopen our communities. https://t.co/CyVwoszGmF

In order for our economy to make a full recovery we must support essential services like the police firefighters and sanitation workers. That is why I authored the SMART Fund legislation to help the states and towns hit hardest by the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/gigQ42XRXl

B-52 bombers from Barksdale Air Force Base in Bossier will be flying over New Orleans and Baton Rouge tomorrow to honor first responders and essential workers during this COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/NG2scoKpWD

As COVID-19 testing has ramped up there may be a need for more swabs to perform the tests. A professor at LSU Shreveport has begun 3D printing more swabs to help with the demand for testing. https://t.co/3E6Idxq4oJ

Looking for a way to help during the COVID-19 outbreak? Donating blood/plasma is an easy way to make a direct impact in helping people that are affected with the virus. Blood centers are in desperate need for more blood so donate today. https://t.co/iotKo7KheE

The SMART fund is a bipartisan solution to help states like Louisiana that have been hit hard by COVID-19. It will bring relief to state and local govts so they can respond to the  public health and economic crisis while maintaining essential services.  https://t.co/ci9pFXULrV
Rouse's Supermarket has been taking great strides to aid the community during the coronavirus pandemic. #LiftingUpLA https://t.co/uzfQY0nbES \

Our Health Care professionals are true heroes. They have worked tirelessly to help combat this crisis. We thank them for all of their hard work and we will continue to pray for them as they combat the coronavirus on the front lines. https://t.co/Qa2QyLKygq

Saudi Arabia and Russia’s price war is tanking oil prices and putting smaller US energy producers in jeopardy. COVID19 is also decreasing demand. Thousands of jobs in Louisiana and our nation’s national security rely on a strong U.S. energy industry. https://t.co/vEDoHUFaT8

Thankful for the hard working medical professionals that worked tirelessly to help @EdwardTedJames and many others recover. I am inspired by Rep. James' story and happy that he has recovered from COVID-19. https://t.co/vNdUGUXa1x

To get past this crisis I'm working to implement an immune registry for the coronavirus. By knowing who is immune we can begin to get back to work sooner as we take on this medical crisis. https://t.co/ElYpPXTUGc

As people recover from COVID-19 it is likely they are immune to the virus. If so they would be able to go back into the workforce without  being infected or infecting others. We need an immunization registry to better inform our strategy of getting people back to work safely. https://t.co/tHOLNWy2OT
See my most recent Open Letter to Louisiana about COVID-19 below: https://t.co/DeFR1Hx1ho
On #NationalDoctorsDay we give thanks to the brave men and women combating this virus. They are battling day in and day out to save the lives of those at risk struggling with COVID-19.

Data shows that individuals confirmed to have recovered from COVID-19 are most likely immune to the virus and are able to interact with others without spreading the virus. By knowing who is immune we can better resolve our economic and medical crisis https://t.co/ZSKTOeBmCQ

During the COVID-19 outbreak Kurzweil Education is offering their Kurzweil 3000 online program for free. It can help students with dyslexia and other students in need as more of our schools transition to online learning. https://t.co/BIxlwlztGa
Some local businesses have begun switching gears to aid in the fight against the coronavirus:  https://t.co/GcwQMF8fSf

If people stay at home and maintain social distancing the crest of this wave will pass quickly. Everyone needs to stay at home and limit their contact with others so we can curb the rapid spread of the coronavirus. https://t.co/MWxdjOE2tE

A slower spread of #COVID19 will allow our health care system to handle cases over time instead of becoming overwhelmed with an influx of cases at once. YOU can help save lives by doing your part to #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/U5b6cGOX7f

As the number of #COVID19 cases in Louisiana continues to rise please be sure to do your part to slow the spread and protect yourself and your family from infection. Contact the Louisiana COVID-19 hotline if you have questions or need more information. https://t.co/Zs36Un2rEs

Most people that are infected by #COVID19 will have minimal symptoms or may not even know they are spreading the virus. That means the choices we make today will be the difference in lives lost vs lives saved. Do your part to #FlattenTheCurve by following these best practices: https://t.co/vSYi2Z6ETh

Hospitals can only hold a certain number of patients at once. The best way to ensure there are enough beds available is to #FlattenTheCurve. Put simply decreasing the rate of infection of #COVID19 will save lives. Do your part wash your hands & stay home if you're feeling sick. https://t.co/oEC3A5uzXX

We all have a part to play in limiting the spread of the coronavirus. If you feel sick stay home. By staying home you are doing your part to slow the spread of the virus in your community. We are all in this together. https://t.co/cBtEPrRp4o

The White House Coronavirus Task Force and @realDonaldTrump announced new guidelines every American should follow to save lives and reduce the impact of the coronavirus outbreak. We must do our part to limit the spread of the virus. https://t.co/ZIPZ7eRf2G

If it rains 8 inches over 2 hours it overwhelms a city's drainage system but if it rains 8 inches over 5 days the system can handle it better. It's the same when it comes to our hospitals with COVID-19 cases. We must slow the spread and #flattenthecurve. https://t.co/FUAMRHFHIt

Even if you feel healthy we must use social distancing to slow the spread of the virus.  A spike in COVID-19 cases could overwhelm our hospitals. We all have a part to play to #flattenthecurve https://t.co/IH23oky4rJ

There is a serious threat of #COVID19 cases spiking & overwhelming our health systems. “The only way to prevent this is social distancing today...That means keeping as many people home as possible starting now.“ Even if you feel healthy: avoid groups stop the spread save lives https://t.co/wbU5XdrLpF

As COVID-19 continues to impact our communities please follow these steps below to limit the spread of the virus. With your cooperation we'll slow the rate of infection and help to ensure those affected by COVID-19 have the resources available for treatment and recovery. https://t.co/VsabV8aqXK
Resources for Families during Covid-19:   https://t.co/MqXjUMY3bK

Slowing the rate that COVID-19 spreads must be our top priority. Decreasing the rate of spreading will give our health care industry the ability to treat a large number of patients over time instead of overwhelming the system at once. #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/fTnPnhwql2

There is a lot of news on COVID-19 and it can be overwhelming. If you have questions or need more information on how to keep yourself and your loved ones safe the Louisiana COVID-19 hotline is available 24/7 to help you receive the most up-to-date information. https://t.co/ggjHhFCOXa
I'm working to ensure Congress is doing their job to respond appropriately to COVID-19 and to make sure our public health apparatus is carrying out its responsibilities. https://t.co/JVEUSzuGVj

(1/5) It seems like strange times…and it is as the talk of the coronavirus and the fluctuation of the stock market has everyone’s attention. As your Senator I want you to know that I am concerned about the welfare of all Louisiana citizens and as a doctor I am engaged with the

Red tape is hampering our response time to COVID-19. I'm working to ensure we cut through the red tape so that we can be effective in limiting the spread of the virus. Listen to my latest interview about what we are doing to limit the impact of COVID-19. https://t.co/qBI3SoGpik

Members of our community have contracted COVID-19 and it is likely more cases will emerge over the next week. There are steps we can take and are taking to limit the impact of the virus. https://t.co/2bPePq28pq

We are making sure that Louisiana and the country are prepared for the coronavirus. Vaccine and treatment development is underway. We are working on the groundwork to ensure it is available for all Louisianians.  https://t.co/y3bvh6QOqd
The coronavirus is serious but some are trying to stoke public fear for political gain against @realDonaldTrump.  https://t.co/hXdwZDTy7u

We must take the politics out of the preparations for the Corona Virus. The only thing we have to fear is the fear of the virus itself. The Trump administration is making sure we are prepared. #lasen https://t.co/Mw6V1lGQbw

As a doctor who ran vaccine programs to decrease the spread of disease @realDonaldTrump is doing what’s necessary to protect Americans from the #coronavirus. Democrats’ attacks are unfounded and aimed at stoking fear for political gain.
